place.name: BELCHFORD
place.gazetteerText: BELCHFORD, or Belshford, a parish in Horncastle district, Lincoln; on the Wolds, 4½ miles NNE of Horncastle r. station. Post Town, Horncastle. Acres, 2,390. Real property, £3,885. Pop., 638. Houses, 148. The manor belongs to R. Vyner, Esq. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £425.* Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church is good; and there are two Methodist chapels and a national school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
